Rose of Lima, T.O.S.D. (April 20, 1586  August 24, 1617), was a member of the 
Third Order of Saint Dominic in Lima, Peru, who became known for both her life 
of severe asceticism and her care of the needy of the city through her own private 
efforts. A lay member of the Dominican Order, she has been declared a saint by 
the ... She rejected all suitors against the objections of her friends and her family.
